bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The owner of a well must keep, for the period set out in subsection (1) (b), a well decommission report made in respect of the well under section 78 [well decommission reports submitted to both comptroller and well owner], 79 [well decommission reports submitted to well owner only] or 80, which is prescribed for the purposes of section 116 (1) (b) of the Act.

If the owner of a well conveys or disposes of the well owner's interest in the well, the well owner must transfer all information and records referred to in subsection (2) that are in the custody or under control of the well owner to the new owner of the well or other person to whom the interest in the well is conveyed or otherwise disposed.
A person who does either of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to advise the comptroller of changes to the information included in the register as and when required to do so under section 12 (1) (a) [notice to comptroller];
fails to advise the comptroller of ceasing to work in Canada as a well driller or well pump installer as and when required to do so under section 12 (1) (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who fails to remove a well pit as and when required to do so under section 36 (2) [well pit restrictions — water supply wells] commits an offence.
A person who fails to upgrade or replace an existing hand pump as required under section 51 (2) [hand pumps in water supply wells] commits an offence.
A person who does any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to protect a well identification plate from physical damage as and when required to do so under section 56 (1) (a) [protection and replacement of well identification plates];
fails to ensure that a well identification plate remains securely attached to the well and plainly visible as and when required to do so under section 56 (1) (b);
fails to report the loss or damage of a well identification plate to the comptroller and request a replacement as and when required to do so under section 56 (1) (c);
fails to install a replacement well identification plate as and when required to do so under section 56 (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who does any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to ensure that the surface of the ground immediately around a wellhead remains sloped to prevent ponding around the wellhead as required under section 58 (1) (a) [general operating requirements for well and area around wellhead];
fails to ensure that access to the well and wellhead is maintained for inspection purposes as and when required to do so under section 58 (2) (a);
fails to ensure that the area immediately around a wellhead is kept clear of all obstructions as and when required to do so under section 58 (2) (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who fails to ensure that any water is conveyed away from a wellhead within a well sump, pump house or well pit as and when required to do so under section 59 [drainage away from wellhead — maintenance of wells in well sumps, pump houses or well pits] commits an offence.
A person who does either of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to comply with the storage requirements under section 62 (1) [storage near water supply wells] by leaving, storing or allowing to accumulate any foreign matter within 3 m of the wellhead of a water supply well;

fails to prevent any foreign matter that is left, stored or allowed to accumulate more than 3 m from a water supply well from travelling to within 3 m of the wellhead of a water supply well as and when required to do so under section 62 (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who fails to configure the wellhead or equip a well in a manner that prevents the flow of water back into the well as required under section 66 (a) [additional requirements — stopping or controlling artesian flow] commits an offence.
A person who does any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to ensure that any equipment installed to control artesian flow and prevent water from flowing back into a well is maintained as required under section 68 (a) [maintenance of equipment installed to control artesian flow];
fails to protect any equipment installed to control artesian flow and prevent water from flowing back into a well from damage caused by freezing as required under section 68 (b);
removes any equipment installed to control artesian flow and prevent water from flowing back into a well for purposes other than those permitted under section 68 (c);
fails to ensure that any equipment installed to control artesian flow and prevent water from flowing back into a well is replaced as and when required under section 68 (d).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who fails to complete and submit a well identification report as and when required to do so under section 75 [well identification reports by owner of well supplying water supply system] commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under this section is liable on conviction to the penalties set out in section 106 (6) [general offences] of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The comptroller must not, under section 7 (d) (ii) [registers of well drillers and well pump installers], remove any person from the register of well drillers or the register of well pump installers, as the case may be, merely because the person fails to maintain a requirement for registration on or after April 26, 2013, in relation to certification as a Ground Water Drilling Technician or a Ground Water Pump Technician issued by the Canadian Ground Water Association before April 26, 2013.

For the purposes of section 81 (2) [retention of records], a reference to a "well identification report" includes information regarding the identification, if any, of a well that was reported under the former regulation.

The definition of "well construction report" in section 1 (1) [definitions and interpretation] includes a well construction report relating to the construction or alteration of a well that was completed before this regulation came into force, if available.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — well decommission report and well closure report
bcl:section.bcl:text: The definition of "well decommission report" in section 1 (1) [definitions and interpretation] includes a well closure report relating to the decommissioning or closure of a well that was completed under the former regulation.

bcl:schedule.bcl:schedulesubtitle: Information in Artesian Flow Management Reports

bcl:section.bcl:text: A report by a professional in respect of artesian flow management required under section 67 [report on artesian flow management] of this regulation must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the owner, location and identification of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name, mailing address, telephone number and, if available, the email address of the owner of the well;
the property on which the well is located, described by its site address, legal description or parcel identifier number (PID);
either

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the universal transverse mercator (UTM) zone and the UTM coordinates of the well recorded to the nearest metre, or
the latitude and longitude of the well recorded in decimal degrees to at least 5 decimal places, or recorded in degrees, minutes and seconds with the seconds recorded to at least 2 decimal places;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if a well identification plate is attached to the well, the well identification number,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to actions taken to mitigate or remediate damage caused by artesian flow:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a description of the assessment of artesian flow, including rate of flow, artesian pressure, site conditions and visible impacts;
a description of the construction of the well and the observed state of the artesian flow in respect of the well, including a scaled drawing that shows the construction and the observed state;
in respect of any actions taken to attempt to stop or bring the artesian flow under control, or remediate any damage caused by the artesian flow, a description of the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: any actions taken by the professional or, to the knowledge of the professional, by another person;
the timeline for the actions;
if known, the name and contact information of another person who took the actions;
any observations, or proof, of the actions taken by another person under clause (A);
any material, including sealant, added into the flowing artesian well;
the reasons for the failure of the attempts to stop or bring the artesian flow under control,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an evaluation by the professional in respect of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a description of the proposed manner of managing the artesian flow, including the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the exceptional circumstances that make it not practicable to stop or bring the artesian flow under control under section 52 (1) (a) or (b) [controlling artesian flow during construction] of the Act;
the method by which the flow of water will be prevented from flowing back into the well;
if the well will be altered, modified or configured differently, a description of what is proposed and a scaled drawing of the well;
the anticipated work plan and timeline for implementation;
the estimated reduction of artesian flow;
options, if any, for managing the artesian flow other than the proposed manner;
any potential threats to property, public safety or the environment that may be posed by the proposed manner;

any other potential impacts that may be caused by the proposed manner, including to any public or private lands or activities, to infrastructure, to stream water, to any aquifer, to other water users or holders of water rights or to wildlife, fisheries, habitats or other ecosystems;
options, if any, for potential remediation of any adverse impacts that may be caused by the proposed manner, such as those described in clauses (G) and (H);
the estimated cost of managing the artesian flow in accordance with the proposed manner, including maintenance and monitoring costs that may be anticipated;
the estimated cost of stopping or bringing the artesian flow under control;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: any conclusions as to whether the proposed manner of managing the artesian flow

bcl:clause.bcl:text: would be more suitable than stopping or bringing the artesian flow under control, and
would not pose a threat to property, public safety or the environment;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the reasons or basis for the conclusions under subparagraph (ii), including the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: an evaluation of the risks and consequences of the proposed manner of managing the artesian flow as compared to other options;
an evaluation of the likelihood that the proposed manner of managing the artesian flow will satisfy the requirements of section 52 (6) of the Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name and business contact information of the professional, including business name, if any, address, telephone number and, if available, email address and fax number;
a summary of the professional's experience with controlling or managing artesian flow.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 1 of this Schedule does not limit any other provision of this regulation that may require the inclusion of information in a report in respect of artesian flow management.
A well identification report required under section 75 [well identification reports by owner of well supplying water supply system] of this regulation must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the owner and location of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name, mailing address, telephone number and, if available, the email address of the owner of the well that is for the purpose of supplying a water supply system;
the name of the well, if any;
the name of the water supply system;
the property on which the well is located described by its site address, legal description or parcel identifier number (PID);
either

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the universal transverse mercator (UTM) zone and the UTM coordinates of the well recorded to the nearest metre, or
the latitude and longitude of the well recorded in decimal degrees to at least 5 decimal places or recorded in degrees, minutes and seconds with the seconds recorded to at least 2 decimal places,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the well identification plate:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the well identification number;
a description of where the well identification plate is attached;
the name of the person attaching the well identification plate;
the date of attachment of the well identification plate, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: any available well construction report relating to the well, or
any information on the depth and diameter of the well.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 1 of this Schedule does not limit any other provision of this regulation requiring the inclusion of information in a well identification report.

A well construction report required under section 76 [well construction reports submitted to both comptroller and well owner] or 77 [well construction reports submitted to well owner only] of this regulation must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the owner and location of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name, mailing address, telephone number and, if available, the email address of the owner of the well;
the property on which the well is located, described by its site address, legal description or parcel identifier number (PID);
either

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the universal transverse mercator (UTM) zone and the UTM coordinates of the well recorded to the nearest metre, or
the latitude and longitude of the well recorded in decimal degrees to at least 5 decimal places or recorded in degrees, minutes and seconds with the seconds recorded to at least 2 decimal places,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the type of work, class of well and method of drilling:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: whether the report relates to the drilling of, or an alteration to, the well;
the class and, if applicable, category or subclass of the well;
if the well is a water supply well, the intended use or purpose of the water supply well;
the method of drilling the well,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to geological materials and their water-bearing characteristics:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a description of the geological materials encountered during drilling or alteration, including the depth at which the materials are encountered and whether they are water-bearing;
if the well is drilled into bedrock, the depth of water-bearing zones, if any, encountered in bedrock and their estimated flow,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the construction of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the details of casings used, if any, including surface casing;
if a drive shoe was used;
the diameter of the hole;
the total depth drilled;
the finished well depth;
the type and depth of any backfill materials or sealant placed in the well;
the details of the surface seal and the method of its installation, if a surface seal was installed;
the details of the screen assembly and filter pack material, if any;
the details of liner used, if any,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the well was developed, the following information relating to the development of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the method of development;
the duration of development,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a well yield test was conducted, the following information relating to the well yield test:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the method, rate and duration of well yield testing;
the drawdown in water level at the end of well yield testing;
the well yield estimated from the test;
if the well was hydrofractured, any increase in well yield resulting from hydrofracturing,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the completion of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if a casing was installed, the final length of the casing stick-up;
the static water level or shut-in pressure level, whichever is applicable;
whether the well was disinfected;
the type of well cap used, and if a well cover was also used, the type of well cover used,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a well identification plate is required, the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the well identification number;
the location where the well identification plate is attached,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if available, the well tag number,
the following information relating to the person responsible for drilling or altering the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if applicable, the registration number of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person responsible for drilling or altering the well, and
the person who drilled or altered the well, if different from the person referred to in clause (A);

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name and business contact information, including business name, if any, address, telephone number and, if available, email address and fax number of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person responsible for drilling or altering the well, and
the person who drilled or altered the well, if different from the person referred to in clause (A),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the starting and completion dates of the work,

a copy of alternative specifications relating to the well, if any, made under section 18 (3) [siting of water supply wells and permanent dewatering wells] of this regulation, including the engineer's acceptance and the terms and conditions, if any, relating to the alternative specifications,

a copy of the documentation referred to in section 19 (2) [siting of recharge wells and injection wells] of the regulation, including the design, the engineer's acceptance and the terms and conditions, if any, and
a copy of any drilling authorization for the well.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 1 of this Schedule does not limit any other provision of this regulation requiring the inclusion of information in a well construction report.

A well decommission report required under section 78 [well decommission reports submitted to both comptroller and well owner], 79 [well decommission reports submitted to well owner only] or 80 [well decommission reports for flowing artesian wells] of this regulation must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the owner and location of the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name, mailing address, telephone number and, if available, the email address of the owner of the well;
the property on which the well is located described by its site address, legal description or parcel identifier number (PID);
either

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the universal transverse mercator (UTM) zone and the UTM coordinates of the well recorded to the nearest metre, or
the latitude and longitude of the well recorded in decimal degrees to at least 5 decimal places or recorded in degrees, minutes and seconds with the seconds recorded to at least 2 decimal places,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if a well identification plate is attached to the well, the well identification number;
if available, the well tag number;
the class and, if applicable, category or subclass of the well;
the diameter of the hole;
the depth of the well;
the method of drilling, if known;
the diameter and material of the casing or liner, if any;
the reason for decommissioning;
the method of decommissioning;
the details of decommissioning, including the depths, types and amounts of sealant and backfill materials, and any remaining casing,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following information relating to the person responsible for decommissioning the well:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if applicable, the registration number of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person responsible for decommissioning the well, and
the person who decommissioned the well, if different from the person referred to in clause (A);

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the name and business contact information, including business name, if any, address, telephone number and, if available, email address and fax number of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the person responsible for decommissioning the well, and
the person who decommissioned the well, if different from the person referred to in clause (A),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the starting and completion dates of the work,

a copy of alternative specifications relating to the well, if any, made under section 72 [alternative specifications for decommissioning wells] of this regulation for the decommissioning of the well, including the engineer's acceptance and the terms and conditions, if any, relating to the specifications, and
if the well is a water supply well, a drilled recharge well, a drilled injection well or a permanent dewatering well, a copy of any available well construction report relating to the well.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 1 of this Schedule does not limit any other provision of this regulation requiring the inclusion of information in a well decommission report.
